op_long_description: Simulate reads from the reference genome 'genome.fasta'
Limit the number of bases per output file to this.
When set, simulate reads by reading from 'filename', rather than simulating from a genome. The format of the fasta titles should be >read_index|chr|start_pos|end_pos

op_short_description: Use lengths from the alchemy model
op_long_description: Use lengths from the alchemy model, rather than the read length.  This is used in conjunction with the sourceReadsFile, to modulate the lenghts  of the reads.

op_short_description: Set read length to a fixed value
op_long_description: Set simulated read length to a fixed value of 'length', rather than sampling from a length mode.
Use 'name' for movies rather than m000_000...
Read in the titleTable to assign chromosome indices from simulated reads

op_short_description: alternative name for the output file
op_long_description: Use an alternative name for the output file, rather than 'simulated'
The number of files to simulate.
When set, scales the length of the average read to L

Use this when running alignment through compareSequences.py and writing to cmp.h5. Specify a map between movie names and chromosome/positions. 
When set, the simulated positions are not sored in the bas.h5 files and instead printed to 'filename'
Add to the title table a field that has the percent repeat content of the read shown by lower case in the reference.
